snippet.textDisplay: I wonder when Nintendo will drop Mario. Actually, I wonder when all of the companies will drop their mascots and make something innovative and new for us.....
snippet.textOriginal: I wonder when Nintendo will drop Mario. Actually, I wonder when all of the companies will drop their mascots and make something innovative and new for us.....

snippet.textDisplay:
What a silly argument. Nintendo takes more risks and experiments more with Mario than any other "mascot" developer does with their properties.

I'm hardly a huge Mario fan, but come on, you can't say they're all even remotely close to being similar.
snippet.textOriginal:
What a silly argument. Nintendo takes more risks and experiments more with Mario than any other "mascot" developer does with their properties.

I'm hardly a huge Mario fan, but come on, you can't say they're all even remotely close to being similar.

snippet.textDisplay: Just fucking ignore it...
snippet.textOriginal: Just fucking ignore it...

snippet.textDisplay: I doubt they will to be honest. I mean, it is one of the most iconic video game series of all time, arguably THE most iconic, and correct me if I'm wrong, but if I'm right then it's also the longest running (I don't really think Pac-Man counts anymore at this point).
snippet.textOriginal: I doubt they will to be honest. I mean, it is one of the most iconic video game series of all time, arguably THE most iconic, and correct me if I'm wrong, but if I'm right then it's also the longest running (I don't really think Pac-Man counts anymore at this point).

snippet.textDisplay: You don't have to squeeze out a franchise to make money, but people do because it's easier.

snippet.textDisplay:
I was wondering if Super Mario Galaxy would make it onto this list.

Now that I think about it, Super Mario Galaxy is the spiritual sequel to Super Mario 64 and Super Mario Sunshine.  3D Mario games are few and far between, but damn are they good.
snippet.textOriginal:
I was wondering if Super Mario Galaxy would make it onto this list.

Now that I think about it, Super Mario Galaxy is the spiritual sequel to Super Mario 64 and Super Mario Sunshine.  3D Mario games are few and far between, but damn are they good.

snippet.textDisplay: @PaperMario15 I agree with your comment. Seems like most gaming websites prefer SMG 2 but I prefer the first one. The music was memorable (I can't remember any tune from smg2), and I played until I got all of the stars. SMG 2 was more of the same, which wasn't bad, but it was not as good as playing SMG 1 for the first time.
snippet.textOriginal: @PaperMario15 I agree with your comment. Seems like most gaming websites prefer SMG 2 but I prefer the first one. The music was memorable (I can't remember any tune from smg2), and I played until I got all of the stars. SMG 2 was more of the same, which wasn't bad, but it was not as good as playing SMG 1 for the first time.

snippet.textDisplay: @oscarnswe Galaxy 2 perfected all the mechanics in the first one, and actually had a competent HUD. I'd go with that one.
snippet.textOriginal: @oscarnswe Galaxy 2 perfected all the mechanics in the first one, and actually had a competent HUD. I'd go with that one.

snippet.textDisplay:
@oscarnswe Easier to decide than you'd think.

Galaxy 1 was a huge step forward for Mario in terms of both gameplay and music.
Galaxy 2 was a mishmash of recycled content with a few lousy new features.

Take your pick.
snippet.textOriginal:
@oscarnswe Easier to decide than you'd think.

Galaxy 1 was a huge step forward for Mario in terms of both gameplay and music.
Galaxy 2 was a mishmash of recycled content with a few lousy new features.

Take your pick.

snippet.textDisplay: If you think about it, the original mario games were all linear.  When the series went to 3D (mario 64) it suddenly became non-linear.
snippet.textOriginal: If you think about it, the original mario games were all linear.  When the series went to 3D (mario 64) it suddenly became non-linear.

snippet.textDisplay: I have to disagree, I believe this song is one of the best.  I think it's the melancholy violin  that mixes with the marching drum so well.
snippet.textOriginal: I have to disagree, I believe this song is one of the best.  I think it's the melancholy violin  that mixes with the marching drum so well.

snippet.textDisplay: What I meant by linear (and don't take that as a bad thing, because it certainly isn't), is that the paths you need to take to get to the different stars are handed to you. You are forced to take that certain path to get to that certain star. Except for the secret stars of course. And this is why M64 didn't feel as linear.
snippet.textOriginal: What I meant by linear (and don't take that as a bad thing, because it certainly isn't), is that the paths you need to take to get to the different stars are handed to you. You are forced to take that certain path to get to that certain star. Except for the secret stars of course. And this is why M64 didn't feel as linear.

snippet.textDisplay:
no, he just wanted the game to be a refreshing change of pace from the usual platforming games.  

i dont think this one is any more linear than SM64 though.

snippet.textDisplay: And the gusty garden theme too. I like the haunted galaxy violin too.
snippet.textOriginal: And the gusty garden theme too. I like the haunted galaxy violin too.

snippet.textDisplay: You know, I've heard a lot of people drooling about this song, but it doesn't seem so great to me.  To me, the best song so far is Bowser Star Reactor.
snippet.textOriginal: You know, I've heard a lot of people drooling about this song, but it doesn't seem so great to me.  To me, the best song so far is Bowser Star Reactor.

snippet.textDisplay: Miyamoto went to the whole galaxy thing to escape the linear qualities of Mario o.0
snippet.textOriginal: Miyamoto went to the whole galaxy thing to escape the linear qualities of Mario o.0

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah it's better than SM64, and that's coming from someone who has amazing memories of that game. It's probably the best game I've played in years. It's more linear though, so it's more like a 2D Mario in that sense. Awesome game.
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah it's better than SM64, and that's coming from someone who has amazing memories of that game. It's probably the best game I've played in years. It's more linear though, so it's more like a 2D Mario in that sense. Awesome game.
